itunesq

Class Skins

  • Object
    • Skins

  • public class Skins
extends Object
    Class that represents window skins. This is a singleton class.

    Skins consist primarily of colors for elements of GUI widgets. Font is also included, but currently is rather pointless since it's the same for every skin.

    A skin is a named entity that is a collection of HTML color codes that complement each other, for an amazingly pleasant use experience.

    Author:
    Jon

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Skins.Element
      The type of skin element, for example a border around a portion of the window.
      static class  Skins.Window
      The specific window, for example the window showing the list of tracks.

        Returns:
        singleton class instance

      • getCurrentSkinName

        public String getCurrentSkinName()
        Gets the current skin name.
        Returns:
        current skin name

      • getSkinNames

        public Sequence<String> getSkinNames()
        Gets the list of skin names.
        Returns:
        list of skin names

      • initializeSkinElements

        public void initializeSkinElements(String skinName)
        Initializes the skin element values from a named skin.
        Parameters:
        skinName - named skin

      • registerWindowElements

        public void registerWindowElements(Skins.Window window,
                                   Map<Skins.Element,List<Component>> elements)
        Registers the elements for a specific window that require skinning.
        Parameters:
        window - window for which elements are being registered
        elements - map of the element type to a list of components

      • registerDynamicWindowElements

        public void registerDynamicWindowElements(Skins.Window window,
                                          Map<Skins.Element,List<Component>> elements)
        Registers additional dynamic elements for a specific window that require skinning. This is used when some of the content of a window is dynamically built in the code, and is thus not derived from the BXML file.
        Parameters:
        window - window for which elements are being registered
        elements - map of the element type to a dynamic list of components

      • pushSkinnedWindow

        public void pushSkinnedWindow(Skins.Window window)
        Pushes a window onto the window stack. The window stack keeps the current set of stacked windows, so they can all be re-skinned if the user changes the skin name from the top window of a stack.
        Parameters:
        window - window to be pushed

      • popSkinnedWindow

        public void popSkinnedWindow()
        Pops a window off of the window stack and throws it away. We don't need to do anything with the window, because its only purpose is to let reskinWindowStack know which windows to re-skin. Once that has happened there is nothing else to do.

      • reskinWindowStack

        public void reskinWindowStack()
        Re-skins all the windows on the window stack. This is called when the skin is changed via preferences.

      • skinMe

        public void skinMe(Skins.Window window)
        Applies the skin values to the elements for a specific window.
        Parameters:
        window - window for which skin elements should be applied

      • mapComponentsToSkinElements

        public Map<Skins.Element,List<Component>> mapComponentsToSkinElements(List<Component> components)
        Maps each component to all of the skin elements that apply, for a list of window components.
        Parameters:
        components - list of window components
        Returns:
        map of element to applicable components
